website_summaries.verdict: If you love watching hummingbirds, this is the feeder to get – it attracts them and provides perching areas for a full-effect viewing experience.
pros: Revamped feeder improves on the original unique design with its elevated perch for hummingbirds to roost while feeding out of 4 ports
Has a sturdy build that provides a clear view of feeding birds
cons: Some small insects can find their way into the feeding jar
Smaller hummingbirds may not be able to reach all of the nectar when it begins to get low

customer_reviews.title: COUNTERFEIT!!
customer_reviews.text: After 10 weeks, the base started leaking. When I received it, I thought it looked rougher than the one I purchased at a nursery. The hanger was mottled, like it had been rusted. I almost returned it but figured it would be OK. Wrong. Can't help but think this must have been a "second" but it was delivered in a box similar to the feeder I purchased elsewhere. Edit: This has a lifetime guarantee. I contacted the company, Aspects. They said that THEY DO NOT SELL TO AMAZON. THIS IS A COUNTERFEIT.
customer_reviews.author: Dogmama

customer_reviews.title: Look for better quality feeder. Design flaw!!
customer_reviews.text: I am reassessing my previous experiences with this feeder. After using these for years, with each feeder lasting at least a year, the last four feeders that I have purchased all failed in the same way within months. The failure is where the hanger screws into the plastic base. This has broken in the same way in all four feeders. There should be a metal piece into which the metal hanger is screwed. This is a poorly designed feeder that will certainly fail in the same way with time.
customer_reviews.author: Brimmich

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Recommend to Buy
customer_reviews.text: Have utilized the inexpensive inverted feeders for years and have had multiple Hummer families feeding for over 20 years. Bought this "horizontal dish" feeder after reading the hype. Had feeder up for 2 months during the prime migration/nesting season here in Florida. Hummers would come to their known feeder location and run in to this foreign shape. Fly around and depart without drinking. Went back to the inexpensive inverted feeder and placed it 1 foot from the HummZinger (hoping the overflow Hummers would not wait but drink from the other feeder). Hummer families are back feeding at the original inverted feeder and ignoring the HummZinger. I took down the HummZinger and would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but mold develops quickly, and there are too many ridges and prongs to clean. See picture. I try to clean it with q-tips and toothpicks and such, but it's very time-consuming. I take it down weekly to refill and clean, but it always develops these problems. I don't understand why the feeder holes require these prongs.
customer_reviews.author: Tech guy

customer_reviews.title: hanging hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: This unit, highly recommended by my daughter, is really of superior quality. Being made of durable polycarbonate, instead of lesser [weaker and more brittle] plastics, it's a long-term investment. Linked with Amazon's seven-foot shepherds crook -- the effective height if a function of the underground section as well as the hanging-hook of the feeder -- it's a nice addition to my yard. Even when the hummingbirds aren't migrating, there is quite often a feeding bird, despite a local falcon. Backing the feeder up against my bamboo seems to provide enough security.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Scott

customer_reviews.title: Hummers ignore this feeder
customer_reviews.text: I read that this unique shaped feeder was great.. I have had none...not even 1 hummingbird on the feeder. Even when I remove my traditional style from my yard (that they flock to) they ignore this one. I change the water every 2 days.. nothing. I move it to a different spot.. nothing. I can’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Marguerite Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for watching hummingbirds!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a second feeder for hummingbirds, and we really like this one. It allows them to sit on the perch while they feed. It’s also attractive. There are some add-on pieces for inside each feeding hole that prevent bees from being able to get at the nectar (bees like the sugar water and are dangerous for hummingbirds so need to keep them away). They’re called Nectar Guard Tips - for some reason they sell those pieces separately (since you have to clean out the sugar water every couple/few days, you need to replace them every once in a while).
customer_reviews.author: Bud02451

customer_reviews.title: Then only truly bee proof hummingbird feeder we have found
customer_reviews.text: We have tried a variety of supposedly bee-proof hummingbird feeders but all of them become completely covered in bees. This one, along with the optional rubber bee-proofing nipples that go inside is the only one the hummers can feed from while the bees remain confused. It is a bit pricey. That's why I only give it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Choose this one
customer_reviews.text: I had two feeders up, but always one territorial Anna's hummingbird guarding both. Recently, I spotted a couple of rufous hummingbirds and was thrilled. Those little terrors will not be intimidated. To the point...I bought two HummZingers and hours later, I have twelve or more around. There was never more than one bird at a feeder before, but this morning there were four peacefully perched and feeding. This feeder really attracts the birds. It is sturdy, easy to clean, easy to fill, and easy to hang. This brand costs more than average, but it is absolutely the best.
customer_reviews.author: Tiaramonkeybird

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, but my hummingbirds seem to prefer the older vertical types.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean and fill. Need to use an ant poison holder between the hook and your tree or pergola or wherever you hang the feeder. Otherwise, you will shortly have a moat full of ants. The water moat is not adequate to prevent this problem. I like the feeder and will continue using it. Maybe the hummers will warm up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austen

customer_reviews.title: Zero hummers - 4 seasons!
customer_reviews.text: I seldom write negative reviews but none of my hummingbirds will even try it! I have tried it for 4 seasons, and they have no interest. My other feeders are very active. I apologize for leaving this review, but this was a very expensive feeder, and worthless for me. Others users seem to be doing better, per reviews. (It also looks like the birds would almost have to stand on their heads to drink, which is perhaps part of the problem.) 90% of the photos show only one bird feeding - not promising so perhaps I am not alone.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Not accepted by the birds.
customer_reviews.text: Birds dont like it. They prefer the standard tree type feeder. Even when the old one is dry they still avoid this unit.. I have old and new in the same area to let them choose. Its been a few months they avoid it completly. I will give it to away. Maybe someone else will get results. Im just going with the birds. Whatever they like works for me. Im not going to try to change their minds.
customer_reviews.author: PeaceThruMusic

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Just got this after trying several very cute feeders that screw in and flip upside down, and basically hummingbirds were not interested in them, and they all leaked. This design is far superior. There are no plastic flowers for squirrels and raccoons to remove. It's so much easier and cleaner to just fill the basin with nectar and then push the top on. Plus, hummingbirds like it! Someone made the point in another review that having a rail is really helpful. See the photo. Unlike many hummingbird feeders, this has a rail so they can rest before, during and after feeding. The hummingbirds really seem to like this feature. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: I have yet to have a humming bird land on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to have a humming bird land on either one of these feeders I purchased. Meanwhile, they are feeding regularly on the $2.80 feeders from Wally World. They are made well, it's just no humming birds land on them.
customer_reviews.author: Huntersterg

customer_reviews.title: Best Feeders
customer_reviews.text: I have dozens of Hummingbird Feeders up every year and these are the absolute easiest to clean and use. They do not hold as much nectar as other feeders, that is okay because of 1) how easy they are to clean 2) you are supposed to change out the nectar every few days to keep mold from growing in them.
customer_reviews.author: DA+

customer_reviews.title: My Allen’s hummingbirds are picky
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hummingbird feeder, because it was the highest rated and it looked very sturdy. The construction is way better than most of the other products out there. However my hummingbirds prefer the cheap ones that I bought a week later. Both are filled with the same nectar, but they completely ignore this one, and it’s just hanging there with no visitors.I switched the two around on their location but still no luck. I switched the two around on their location but still no luck I live on the West Coast and have Allen’s hummingbirds. I’m guessing this species is more attracted to the bottle type feeders.
customer_reviews.author: sandybeach

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it,  but lid isn't tight. Beware of loose lid.
customer_reviews.text: Hummingbirds love it! Why I'm giving it 4 stars... the lid is somehow popping up I'm guessing because their food is getting grossly contaminated at times with debris from the crepe myrtle tree. I'm guessing the wind is blowing it up. I'm not sure. The lid doesn't snap on. It just sits on top. I've only seen this once in the 2 months of owning it. But it's so dangerous for the birds. If I see it again, this feeder is history.
customer_reviews.author: CapiJ

customer_reviews.title: Loved this feeder when It first arrived
customer_reviews.text: Loved this feeder when It first arrived. However, today while I was cleaning it, the hanger broke off as I was trying to get the red top off . The plastic cracked, and is too damaged to glue back together. I liked the design, but the plastic was too flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to clean, unobscured view of birds
customer_reviews.text: This hummingbird feeder is so easy to clean! I love how the nectar portion isn't a bottle where I have to use a bottle brush like other feeders and I appreciate the measurement lines to let me know exactly how much I'm filling each time. The red lid snaps in place, and I never remove the brass hook (I worry the glue between the brass nut and the plastic base might become detached if I accidentally overtighten the brass hook). The design also makes hummingbirds easy to view at any angle!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Woods

customer_reviews.title: My favorite out of many I have tried
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love to feed and watch hummingbirds. We've tried a number of models/designs, and this is our favorite. We live near the Gulf coast. So we must frequently change the sugar/water mixture. This model holds just the right amount of liquid so that it doesn't get used up by our birds before we must replace it. Also, the birds like the rail for perching. I've taken some good photos of them feeding.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds will pick any other feeder than this one if given the choice.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good bird feeder but I have found that all my humming birds prefer any other feeder than this one. This review covers two full summers, I purchased in 2014 and it's now fall 2016. The only way I can get the humming birds to feed from this one is to take down my others. All using the same batch of nectar, similar placement, similar visibility. They just plain don't like this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: DougTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hummingbird feeder, although I've seen plenty in action. The design just blew me away. Hummingbirds actually have to land on the feeder to feed, so you get a really good look at them. Since they're perched, they seem to feed longer. Typically a hummingbird will sit on it for about a minute, popping his head up every 10 seconds or so to look around. Couldn't be happier with this hummingbird feeder! This is the design to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Edgeman

customer_reviews.title: Still dont have all 3 pieces
customer_reviews.text: Second time trying to get complete setup. 40 minutes on phone with 2 reps. The 1st rep lied and said I did not have to return the one piece I did receive. It took the second rep a while to fix this. The feeder is no good as I didn't receive the screw in hanger or the bottom that holds the nectar.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi P.

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder, just overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Great feeder with a smart design. It’s easy to clean, offers an unobstructed view of birds, and looks and feels very sturdy and well-made. Love it so much that I went to order one as a gift for my parents - but found that the price had gone up almost $10 :(. I paid about $16 for the feeder a month ago and now I can’t find it anywhere for less than $25, which seems overpriced for a plastic feeder, even though it is great quality. Other than that irritatingly high price, I have no complaints and think it’s a great feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder, doesn’t leak. Wasps aren’t able to reach the nectar!
customer_reviews.text: I have always used the bottle type feeder and had a big problem with leakage, bee and wasps. I saw these recommended on several websites and decided to give them a try. They work great! Wasps came around for a little while, then they realized they couldn’t reach the nectar! They also have a built in ant moat. I live in the south and our hot summers evaporate the water pretty quickly in the moat though. You might want to get a separate moat that holds more water. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Coder

customer_reviews.title: Best hummingbird feeder hands down
customer_reviews.text: We have had multiple types of feeders in hopes of attracting the little fellas but none seems to work until we got one of these. This is our second one and I highly recommend them. We use a simple homemade brew for our speedy friends, none of that store bought stuff! All you need to do is heat 12 oz to boiling in the microwave (kills any nasty germs), stir in 3 oz of plain sugar, let it cool, pour it into the feeder and voila, instant hummer buffet!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Welch

customer_reviews.title: I love it and so do the hummers!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these last year (without the raised perch) and the hummers liked it so much, I decided to get another and try the raised perch to see which they prefer. As far as I can tell, they really don't care :) They use both. They're easy to clean and fill and the built-in ant moat is great. No problems with ants unless the water evaporates so keep an eye on it. I refill them with fresh solution every week and there's usually water still left in the moat.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: does not spill
customer_reviews.text: I had another hummingbird feeder with tilted flower feeder holes. It spilled all over, the ants loved it, I hated it. Hummers liked it but why not...it fed them. But this is on a balcony, not a yard. Not great for pest control. So I got this! It, so far, is fabulous. The birds love it, it does not spill over, it is easy to take down and doesn't spill in that process, is easy to clean. Nothing negative and all important positives. We all love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cat alog

customer_reviews.title: Break too easily
customer_reviews.text: These hummingbird feeders are of very low quality—especially for the price I paid for them. The pegs that hold the nectar guards break VERY easily. I tried contacting the manufacturer, but they wouldn’t replace them because they don’t directly sell on Amazon. The seller was nice enough to replace them, but all broke after only a year. The feeders (that actually come with nectar guards) of another brand I bought at the same time are holding up very well. I am buying those to replace these broken ones.
customer_reviews.author: Tech User

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, durable hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: I have always had one of the hummingbird feeders with the large container for nectar; however, was looking for something smaller since I change the nectar at least once a week and larger feeders seemed wasteful. This feeder is the perfect size! My hummingbirds have plenty of nectar to drink and I no longer feel like I am wasting so much when I change it 1-2 times per week. Another plus is that this feeder is very easy to clean. I liked this so much that I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Heather CTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: access to the sugar water for hummers
customer_reviews.text: I just received it tonight. However, as I have seen another post about this, it looks like if the feeder is not totally full the hummers can't access the water. If it's filled to the 12 oz mark, fine, but as it lowerers how will they reach water when it's 8 oz? I dont see how this is going to work. I think I will send it back. Seemed like a good concept, but easy access is important to the birds as they get ready to migrate soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob Breunig

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest hummingbird feeder to clean! The top seperates from the bottom for easy cleaning, and you just use a small pipe cleaner to brush the feeding holes clean. The hummingbirds love them, and will just sit and hang out on them after they eat.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: HummZinger feeder
customer_reviews.text: we had trouble with bees in our other feeders but this one the bees came for two days then they were gone and never came back. Now it is for only the humming birds. They love it and we enjoy having them we have been able to sit on our deck as they come in to feed. One came within three feet of my wife and looked her over then came over to me and did the same. It went back and forth looking at us then went to the feeder had it fill and left.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attracts hummingbirds and stays active all day!
customer_reviews.text: There are many things to like about this hummingbird feeder. For starters it really attracts the birds! Additionally, it is very easy to clean and it holds enough liquid food so that I only have to refill it every 4-5 days. The sealed design of the lid keeps insects and other crawling nasties out of the reservoir of sugar water.
customer_reviews.author: Otter

customer_reviews.title: Must use nectar guard tips to keep bees/wasps out
customer_reviews.text: I used this without the nectar guard tips at first,but the bees were going in and out. Ordered the guard tips and they kept the bees out, however, the hummingbirds didn't like it. So I cut off a little bit of the flap on the tips and put it back out. They will now eat at it and it keeps the bees out.
customer_reviews.author: P Winters

customer_reviews.title: Best hummingbird feeder ever!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has attracted more birds than ever! It is so easy to clean and change the food. I replace the sugar water every three days and it takes less than 2 minutes to open, clean, fill and hang back up. I have had other glass feeders and they were a pain to clean, parts broke often and were replaced a couple of times during the season. I have two of these and feel they are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is awesome. My hummingbirds love it - 4 can eat at one time. I think it's cool they can perch while eating instead of having to hover. Easy to assemble, easy to clean, easy to hang. The best feeder I have tried and I have tried many over the years. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: kingmom336

customer_reviews.title: Read the above......
customer_reviews.text: The package came on time. My complaint is that it was not but in a shipping box. It just had the label but on the package and it was not even taped closed. I know the Covid-19 is causing things to get crazy because I work in a Hospital, so I know what crazy is. I've been a Prime member for many years and have never had anything shipped like that. It makes it easy for people to know what their stealing from your porch. Thank you and stay calm... this too shall pass...
customer_reviews.author: Judy Quigley

customer_reviews.title: A hummingbird favorite that is almost worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The hummingbirds love this feeder and so do I. I read that summer heat causes the other kind of feeders to leak and that the design of this one eliminates the problem with leakage. It is easy to fill and there's no problem with heat leakage. I took off one star for price. The metal hanger looks like it could eventually discolor and rust and the design of this feeder requires it to be filled more often than the standard upright feeder.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to maintain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the perch surrounding the feeder ports, and have discovered that my favorite feature is the ease of maintenance. It is easily removed and disassembled, making quick work of cleaning and reassembly. It took the hummingbirds a few weeks to discover it, but they are now visiting regularly. Ants and bees have also discovered it recently so I just added an ant moat and might also consider bee guards on the ports.
customer_reviews.author: moneypenny

customer_reviews.title: YES! A one-piece Base, Easy Hummer Feeder :D
customer_reviews.text: This is my NEW all time FAVORITE hummingbird feeder. It is EXACTLY what I was looking for: a hummingbird feeder with a one piece base! Fill, attach screw-on top, add hanger and voila! Hummingbirds can easily feed from BASIC feeder...I have taken down my multi-piece-base feeders due to inability to see WHERE the food was, needing to tip to sides for food to drip out to verify it's even in there, empty cavities etc. Although the HummZinger was more $$ than what I wanted to spend, I have already spent more than its cost on other feeders that all have the same issue with pesky bases.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviewers I have been tired of leaking bottle types of feeders. I just purchased one to replace one of three locations at my home and couldn't be more satisfied or surprised. I have two out back and one under the roof of our front porch (which is the one I replaced) and have made two wonderful observances. As there is no bottle obstructing the feed ports the humming birds enjoy just hanging out staying dry from the rain. As the bottom is clear you can see their tongues hitting the nectar. Will be ordering two more to replace the ones out back.
customer_reviews.author: mikey

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds love this feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this feeder would live up the hype. And the price kept me from ordering for quite some time. However, the hummingbirds adore this feeder. I have thrown out my other feeders and plan to buy more of these. Bonus: Made in USA
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Smart design and great quality
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase. Worth every penny! My previous feeder was a bottle design that leaked whenever I filled it - annoying but workable, or so I thought until the yellowjackets showed up this month and started chasing the hummers away! Ordered the Hummzinger and it fixed the problem promptly. I didn’t even need the nectar guards. The yellowjackets did try to sniff things out at first, but they left when they realized they can’t reach the nectar. Now I’m happy and the hummingbirds are too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Dripping and Easy Maintenance
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have purchased this style of hummingbird feeder, and though I often like the aesthetics of feeders which hold the nectar in containers above the sipping ports, this one cannot leak at all. I like the built-in ant moat as well. It is very easy to clean and fill. I will continue to use a second hummingbird feeder of a different style as well this season, but I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Song Bird

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I did like the better view of the hummingbirds coming to the feeder without the inverted bottle obstructing the view. However I had the overall impression the birds did not care for this feeder. Possibly they feel more exposed without the cover of a bottle. Also I felt it was rather costly compared to other feeders.
customer_reviews.author: ifixuiz

customer_reviews.title: Beats bottle feeders - no lost nectar!
customer_reviews.text: Like many others I noticed right away that this feeder was well constructed for the price. It is very easy to clean and there is no hot day drainage of nectar due to expansion in the bottle. We were going through a bottle of nectar every other day until we started using this. Easy to clean and the birds love it. Lots of features already explained by others but the design of the bowl and no bottle was what sold us.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Creagan

customer_reviews.title: Birds could not reach the food
customer_reviews.text: The food sits too far down away from the ports. The birds could not reach the food even when it was 100% full. I contacted the manufacturer, Aspects, and they implied that this product is not legitimate. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Liz B.

customer_reviews.title: Perch doesn’t make hummingbirds feel comfortable to feed
customer_reviews.text: Hummingbirds won’t even go near This feeder. Without having a trumpet like flower/feeding hole on this product deters them. They won’t perch at all on the little ledge A waste of my money. If I could return it I would. The only nice feature was the water trap for ants
customer_reviews.author: Heather T. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds really do like it
customer_reviews.text: I read about this feeder online and thought I'd try it, because the upright feeder that I have is pretty much ignored by the hummingbirds. As soon as I put this up, I had hummingbirds fighting for it! What is nice about it is that they can sit on it and eat leisurely and they don't have to keep flying. I wound up buying a second one because they fought over the first one so much. I still keep my upright one out there but they hardly use it.
customer_reviews.author: Pixiegirl

customer_reviews.title: Bees sure do love this one.
customer_reviews.text: My hummingbirds had trouble using this one and pretty much just avoided it. Little bees loved it though. They get inside and swim around until they die. Ick. I tried the little things they sell to make the openings small so the bees don't get it and that worked to keep them out, but the hummers still didn't like it. Perhaps if the flowers were red and the surrounding area a different color? I dunno... I had high hopes for this one.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Withrow

customer_reviews.title: Bigger Is Not Always Better
customer_reviews.text: I have two hummingbird feeders at home, one in front yard and one in back. In front I put the bigger 16 oz version of this feeder and it's too big. When I change the food in it there is still a lot left over. Also for the 3 hummingbirds that hang around our yard, the big one is just too big. This smaller 12 oz feeder I hung it the back and it's just the right size. Holds enough food for the two hummers back there and there is little waste of leftover food. I will probably replace the front one with this smaller size as it's the right one.
customer_reviews.author: ralphh909

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The hummers arrived the day after I put it out. They can perch easily and take their time drinking the nectar. Easy to fill and clean (so essential for the life of the birds). So far so good with ants and bees. The ant moat is a great plus. This is my first foray into feeding these fascinating birds and thanks to this product I think it will become an ongoing and rewarding activity.
customer_reviews.author: CivilEyes

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the right nectar.
customer_reviews.text: Hummingbirds really like it once you find the right nectar. I tried 3 different nectars I purchased, both liquid and powder and I only got hummingbirds once I went to a homemade sugar mixture. Now they come and this feeder let's them sit and drink. And this feeder is so easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Other version is better
customer_reviews.text: I've been using humzingers for years .... the hummers tend to prefer my regular "low railing" feeders over this one. Thats not the real issue .... on the bottom side of the holes are some plastic tabs (I'm guessing to try and keep insects out) that make the feeder a real pain to clean. Going back to the old style.
customer_reviews.author: RGS1965

customer_reviews.title: The perfect hummingbird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the perfect hummingbird feeder. I love that it’s got a perch all the way around the feeder that gives them room to stop and drink. It also has a built-in moat that blocks any crawling insects from getting into the nectar. I like that the cover is bright red that attracts the hummingbirds. The lid on the container has got really good suction so you don’t have to worry about it coming off. It’s made of sturdy plastic. It’s very easy to clean. It will last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Llskala1024

customer_reviews.title: Solid design/good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a well thought out design. Will be easy to clean, good hanger & ant moat built in, what's not to appreciate to keep our hummers happy? As a suggestion for future upgrades, maybe one of the feeding ports could be a "filler" port with a screw on cap to fill the bowl. Maybe the fill port could be located just slightly higher on the lid to hold more food.....but this is a minor suggestion on a solid design. Since I have hummingbirds year round, it will be used daily. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: M. Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE if you love hummers and hate wasps or hornets
customer_reviews.text: I HATE HATE HATE HATE hornets and wasps. I waged a war every flipping year to a psychotic degree until I found this feeder and MUST buy the accompanying nectar guards. I love my hummers. And this feeder made my life non-psychotic because I no longer has to fight with wasps and hornets. They can’t get in and drink the nectar so they don’t even try and leave it alone. You can see the level and the hummers love it.
customer_reviews.author: Adalya Merciless

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST Hummingbird feeder EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not only does it have a little fence for the hummingbirds to rest on, but, it has a moat that you put water in where ants fall into and cannot get out. Best to buy this smaller size since it is best to change nectar every day in very hot weather. I also like to have at least 2 of these little feeders to accommodate territorial hummingbirds. I place them away from each other.
customer_reviews.author: Apassionato

customer_reviews.title: Missing the hanging hook
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my Mother-in-Law and it arrived without the hook part to hang it. I called "Aspects" and was informed that Amazon has been selling counterfeit products and to look for an authentication sticker on the box. Since this was sent to someone else I never saw the box. Aspects kindly agreed to ship her the appropriate hook for the feeder model. Buyer beware. I have purchased other Aspects feeders and give them high marks. Sometimes it pays to order direct from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Katie McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Quality—Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: More expensive then others on the site but MADE IN THE USA and quality is VG. This model is recommended by the owner of a bird specialty shop here in NJ.SHe offers multiple feeders ,fancy etc but if you ask —-She will say —this one.This is my second one to supplement the one I have had for 10 Years which is still as good as the day it was bought
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hummingbird feeder from the same company and/or the same style. I am still using the one I bought about two years ago and added this one because I now have two birds using it and wanted to add a second option for them. I find them sturdy, easy to use and clean and attractive. I like this style compared to others I reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: W. W. Turner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This style of feeder is superior on all counts
customer_reviews.text: I got this because the inverted bottle style started leaking after one season, and it always attracted ants and was hard to clean. This style of feeder is superior on all counts: no leaks, no ants (because of the ant moat), and vastly easier to clean. I would have rated five stars except that it took the birds over a week to start using it. I eventually put some yellow tape around the feeder holes in an effort to attract them. I don't know if that helped or if the hummingbirds just took a while to get used to this one. The previous feeder used to draw birds constantly. We'll see, maybe they'll grow to like this one, too.
customer_reviews.author: RScott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hummingbird Feeder
customer_reviews.text: The Aspects HummZinger HighView feeder works great - attracts plenty of birds and they don't seem to have any trouble emptying the feeder. The HummZinger is easy to clean, easy to assemble and hang - no complaints. Note that I had a similar HummZinger feeder and it lasted 5 years in the Vegas sun before the plastic became brittle and it started to leak. I certainly felt I got my money's worth out of the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Reelgood

customer_reviews.title: Best feeders I've used!
customer_reviews.text: For many years I've used the typical bottle hummingbird feeders. Used and reused. I bought one of these last year to try out. I have now switched my 4 bottle feeders to 4 of these feeders and glad I did. Much easier to clean and keep filled. Well constructed. The materials are sturdy plastic not flimsy. The metal hanger hook is a blessing!
customer_reviews.author: L. Sisler

customer_reviews.title: Best Feeder Anywhere
customer_reviews.text: You change the hummer juice without it getting all over you or running down your arm. Easily comes apart to change the juice but stays together keeping out rain and bugs. The viewing of these little birds as they are coming in and feeding are amazing. No big container to get in your line of view. The holes for the hummers to drink out of are built in.......cleaning is a cinch and nothing wears out! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal product for people who are sick of cleaning the traditional Hummingbird feeders. This makes it easy to remove funk, because there are no hard-to-reach spots inside or out. Much more sanitary design.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Burzynski

customer_reviews.title: Best hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: The best feeder I have bought. It’s very easy to take apart ( red top pops off) easy to clean. Easy for the hummers to perch and feed. I love it. Attracts the hummers easily.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Not as good at attracting hummingbirds
customer_reviews.text: When I moved to my current home, I inherited two hummingbird feeders that were really dirty no matter how much I cleaned them. Bees would also get inside. So after reading a lot of reviews on this particular feeder I went for it. One, bees get in. Two, my hummingbirds are not attracted to it. Not sure what it is or why? I have to say, it is not as intricate so it is easier to clean. I ended up buying another one (glass) with the red and yellow and they like that one.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle M. Iturregui

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping for it to be the Cadillac of hummie feeders but it didn’t work out. I have wasps eating from my old bottle-story feeder and chasing the hummingbirds away, so I thought this feeder design would prevent that. Unfortunately I found wasps and ants floating inside the feeder, and have NO idea how they fit thought the holes!
customer_reviews.author: kumbayah

customer_reviews.title: Hello Yellow Jackets
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my old hummingbird feeder and read the reviews on this. Most seem positive but I had nothing but Yellow Jackets. They were swimming in the water. I finally took it down after 3 days, as the hummingbirds would not use the feeder, and all I had was a swarm of Yellow Jackets. I was so excited to receive this in the mail as I wanted a stand where the hummingbirds could rest while eating. This feeder was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: LittleMissReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds all day long with this
customer_reviews.text: Hummingbirds come all day with this thing. I like to watch them sit on edge and drink for a long time. I had to put duct tape inside out along the pole that goes to the hanger because black ants were getting in like crazy. The little middle section gets dirty and I can’t find a way to clean it without breaking a nail. I have had other feeders though and I like this the best!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: The birds did not like it.
customer_reviews.text: This feeder didn't work for me. Hummingbirds would hover around the feeder but never drank from it. I purchased another feeder that had yellow flowers imprinted on it and the birds came right to it. Perhaps the particular birds in my area prefer yellow flowers? Other than that the feeder was well constructed and easy to use. I like that it is dishwasher safe. Thinking I may paint (with animal safe paint, of course) the little red flowers on it yellow and see if it works better.
customer_reviews.author: LDMullins

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds love this feeder
customer_reviews.text: Hummingbirds love this feeder! We have hummingbirds visit us all day long. I'm making my own nectar using the recipe that comes with the feeder which saves us money and allows us to give fresh food to the birds every week or so. The feeder does a good job of keeping other bugs out of the food reservoir but occasionally I'll find a fly or bee inside. Overall this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Came with UN THREADED HOOK
customer_reviews.text: What a complete waste of money....i bought this item a while back and was so looking forward to using it on my patio....imagine my surprise when i came to try to use it to find that the brass hook was not threaded!!! Hence i am unable to use the hummingbird feeder at all....unless of course i just put it on a table....oh well...unless the company is good enough to send me a new threaded hook i guess it will just sit in the closet! A shame because i think its a good feeder if i can ever get it to hang. Update....Amazon sent me a replacement and now that i have the good item i love it....!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Within A Month
customer_reviews.text: I would expect better quality for this price. All I have purchased have broken at the point where the hook screws into the feeder. The plastic breaks and renders the feeder unusable. Better to go with a less expensive feeder. At least I won’t be out nearly $30 each time it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: debs

customer_reviews.title: Best Hummingbird Feeder EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I love feeding the birds! I have had several hummingbird feeders over the years including some beautiful blown glass ones but if they got the smallest air bubble they would leak - not to mention attract ants and bees. This feeder is awesome. I have gotten more hummingbirds in a week than I did in a year before. The nice part is they actually sit down on the edge to enjoy their snack. I had one hang out for a few minutes just looking around. I purchased one as a gift for someone who has never attracted hummingbirds and within the first hour he was getting them too.
customer_reviews.author: H. C. Hankin

customer_reviews.title: Don't take my word for it--take this little ruby throated beauty
customer_reviews.text: Word is out, and they LOVE it! Great construction and super easy to clean. They stay longer because they can sit while they drink. We're very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KLM

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, looks good
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good, looks good, hummers do n to use it. They go to the other side of the house to use the traditional feeder. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Best Hummingbird Feeder!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, perfect feeder! Bought a feeder locally last fall and hated it so researched online and chose the Hummzinger. I got the 12 oz. size as I have only ever seen one Ruby-Throat hummingbird here. Because of the way the Hummzinger is made and the lack of yellow used on the feeder there are NO bees or wasps on the feeder. I didn't want them as they can kill hummingbirds if they sting them. The Hummzinger is easy to clean, easy to fill, and easy to hang up. I had my very first visitor this afternoon and he or she sat very calmly on the perch while drinking the nectar I had made. :) I'm delighted!
customer_reviews.author: Cairnz

customer_reviews.title: Easiest feeder to clean - EVER!
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this feeder is the cleaning part. I’ve bought one for Christmas gifts for every family member who also feeds hummingbirds. The Highview also lets you actually see the birds beak/tongue as it’s drinking, if you are fortunate enough to place it close. The only downfall is the bee guards are sold separate. For that reason, I don’t have them on my feeders, but I don’t have many bees in my area so it’s not been an issue. If you do have lots of bees, buy the guards.
customer_reviews.author: snkyfox

customer_reviews.title: Poor Workmanship
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a high quality product, however the workmanship that went into it is poor. When I tried to screw the rod into it, it wouldn't start. The threads on the rod were dinged up. I was able to repair the threads with my tap and die set. But then when I hung the bird feeder it became obvious that the threaded insert that holds the rod was installed crooked. The bird feeder is not plumb to the rod, so the nectar leans to one side. Hopefully, the hummingbirds won't notice, but it looks sad hanging crooked outside my window.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Hummers steer clear of this feeder.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try this style feeder because it looked like it would be easy to clean. Have been using the pinchwaist feeders for years but there are many pieces to take apart and clean. The hummers at MY house do not like this HummZinger HighView. One hummer came to it and moved to each feeding port but flew off, not to return. I put the pinchwaist back up and hummers have returned. I don't understand why. Something different I suppose. Wish it would have worked out since it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbird Came Right Away
customer_reviews.text: I received this feeder today and hung it up right away. I was standing outside beside it about an hour later, and a hummingbird flew right by my face. It was headed towards the feeder, but when it realized I was standing there it flew away, but it came back when I went inside. I already had one Hummzinger on my front porch which I've had for years. I wanted this one for outside my kitchen window. I like the HighView aspect of the feeder. The main reason I love these feeders is that they're so easy to clean and you can see the hummingbirds on every port.
customer_reviews.author: C. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: The hummingbirds love it! Since the bar is in a higher position it seems to make it easier for them to sit with their long beaks. I LOVE it because there is no obstruction of view the way most are with the tube going up the middle and I love that they have a place to sit so they can rest. They already use so much energy they need a break! Another thing I LOVE is that the wasps, bees, etc. mostly leave it alone because the liquid is too low in container for them to reach. Ants cant get in either. PLUS this is very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette F

customer_reviews.title: Tips to using it
customer_reviews.text: We have used this feeder before--2 tips: if you have a bee problem with the feeder, just fill it 1/2 way--the bees cannot get to it but the hummers have no problem. At night put it in a plastic bag and stick it in your refrigerator--the cold prevents mold growth and the 1 to 4 sugar water stays fresher. Peace and happy birding
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This hummingbird feeder has a unique design. The hanger is screwed into the basin holding the nectar. The entire cover lifts off to make filling and cleaning easy. some other feeders I have owned had a part that lifts while the feeder stays attached to the basin. This is a much better setup. The only downside is a limited amount of nectar that the basin holds.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Pollan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This one costs a bit more than some of the others but the quality is super nice! I do one cup water with 1/4c sugar in it and it fits perfectly, you could do more as it holds 12oz but I currently don't get many hummers so I don't need to make so much, it just gets wasted. I bought this because one day I saw a hummer zipping around our deck, and I am so pleased to say that within about 3 days of putting it out the hummer was back! I've seen it a few times now. I included a not super clear photo of the hummer, but this one works! Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: NOT ant-proof!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute feeder, however it does NOT keep ants out. Every time I take it down to clean it, there are clusters of big black ants floating around like little islands. At first I thought I hadn’t closed the top tight enough, but I made sure to press it down firmly every time after, ending with the same ant issue. However, the hummingbirds love it, so I keep filling it and putting it back out there!
customer_reviews.author: C. Eagleson

customer_reviews.title: Loving this!
customer_reviews.text: We saw a humming bird checking out our red bird feeder, so decided to replace it with a hummingbird feeder. Had it up just a few hours when we saw our first customer...a female ruby-throated hummingbird (I think). She’s been coming back about every half hour and spends about a minute feeding. She apparently has a favorite portal and lands right on the little perch. Very cute! We live in Central New Jersey.
customer_reviews.author: Eeper

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous hummingbird feeders. Only kind I buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these hummingbird feeders. This is the 3rd one I’ve purchased. They’re easy to clean, don’t leak & durable materials (although one of mine finally cracked and snapped off where the metal hook screws into the base after 3 years of sunlight). I am planning to buy another one to replace a smaller one that needs to be refilled more often.
customer_reviews.author: Scottish Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: I feel like Charlie Brown on Halloween
customer_reviews.text: You know the other kids got candy, and he got rocks. Well I ordered this nifty hummingbird feeder and I got an empty box. Really! Well almost empty. The box was for the correct feeder and it had the wire hanger in it, but no feeder. What is the deal? I asked for a replacement, but apparently I have to send back the empty box. Great.
customer_reviews.author: tommarball

customer_reviews.title: The hummingbirds love it!
customer_reviews.text: The hummers love it! I also bout the mini 8oz and different hummers seem to pick the one they like the best to keep coming back to. I have to keep and eye on the 8oz one because it will be empty when the 12oz is still over half full. More of my hummers seem to prefer the small one. They are both easy to clean and don't drip. A great item!
customer_reviews.author: Mapasmurf

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with hanger.
customer_reviews.text: Might be a good feeder but it is very expensive plastic feeder that does not come with a screw-in hanger such as the pictures imply. This requires going to a store to get such a hanger that has the appropriate size thread and diameter. A lot of extra time and money to invest is what already is a speedy product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It attracts hummingbirds and they sit on this feeder and eat
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it is easy to clean and fill ...and that the hummingbirds can sit on the perch area while drinking the nectar. Three hummingbirds have been attracted by this feeder. They love it and I adore watching them .I have two feeders but they prefer this one because they can rest and eat. Just remember to change the nectar frequently in hot weather.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder, easy to clean and color doesn’t fade.
customer_reviews.text: Great feeder, easy to clean. Lid goes on w/o spraying nectar around. Has a water mote to keep ants out and doesn’t fade over time. I have 4 of these feeders, I love them and the hummers seem to also!
customer_reviews.author: laurel

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD FEEDER
customer_reviews.text: I received this feeder and did all the preparation to the detail. Now I ask you this one question how the heck can the little hummers get their beaks way down into the bottom of this feeder! It is way too deep and I think it is going to go into the trash can as none of my hummers will even try to feed from it. I am really disappointed in this product!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: We could do a commercial for these feeders.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this feeder. Going to buy another. We have the type of feeder with a glass jar upside down on one side of our porch & this HummZinger on the opposite side of the porch. Hands down the Hummingbirds like the HummZinger model the best. They flock to it. Will have to purchase for gifts for my hummingbird lover friends. Easier to handle, fill & keep clean. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dooley

customer_reviews.title: love watching hummingbirds
customer_reviews.text: I love this feeder. I used others before but did not get a lot of hummingbirds. A friend had one like this and when I visited her, she had lots of hummingbirds. The way its made makes it easier for them to sit and enjoy the nectar. They don't have to fly in place but can land, sit and drink. I have lots of hummingbirds now and it is a joy to watch them.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne K. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Hummers Seem to Love These
customer_reviews.text: Hummers seems to love these. Easy to refill and the moat keeps most bugs out. The moat needs cleaned regularly to prevent mildew and algae growth went the temperature is high. Also the nectar tip cover lips on the underneath are fragile so clean with care. Highly recommend these to my friends! Tip: Get nectar tip guards to keep the mini-bugs out of the feeder. Tip
customer_reviews.author: Maelstrom

product_meta.title: Aspects HummZinger HighView 12 Oz Hanging Hummingbird Feeder - 429, Red
product_meta.description: Color:RedThe hummzinger highview feeder offers an upgrade to the classic line of hummingbird feeders. The feeder includes a highview perch that invites hummingbirds to rest comfortably as they drink from any of four feeding ports while also offering an unobstructed view of the birds. The built-in ant moat blocks crawling insects from contaminating nectar. Bright red cover attracts hummers from a distance and removes easily so the bowl can be cleaned quickly and thoroughly. Constructed of unbreakable polycarbonate and backed with a lifetime guarantee.
feature_bullets: The feeder includes a highview perch that invites hummingbirds to rest comfortably as they drink from any of four feeding ports while also offering an unobstructed view of the birds.
Bright red cover attracts humming birds from a distance and is easily removed so the bowl can be cleaned quickly and thoroughly.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,755 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
